column1: Design for Health and Wellbeing MSc
column5: The MSc in Design for Health and Wellbeing is based on working and co-designing with stakeholders right across health care, from hospitals, to mental health services, public health, and the wellbeing of consumers in society. The program is offered as a full-time and part-time option. The part-time option caters for those who are working or have other commitments and requires one day a week on campus. The program facilitates online and blended learning.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 2 years part time
